Detailed Description

Meta Model for SVM training.

Author:
T. Glasmachers
Date:
2006
The C-SVM is a training scheme for Support Vector Machines. It defines a positive constant C controlling the solution complexity.
In the 1-norm SVM formulation, this constant bounds the parameters of the SVM from above, limiting their contribution to the solution. For the 2-norm SVM formulation, the are not bounded from above. Instead, the kernel matrix is reglarized by adding to the diagonal entries.
The C_SVM class is a meta model which is based on an SVM model. Its parameter vector is composed of the SVM hyper- parameters, that is the complexity parameter C and the parameters of a KernelFunction objects.
For unbalanced data, it has proven fertile to consider class specific complexity parameters and instead of a single constant C. These parameters are usually couples by the equation , where ${}$ are the class magnitudes. Therefore, the C_SVM model introduces only the parameter as a model parameter, whereas can be computed from this parameter. As only the parameter is subject to optimization, all derivatives have to be computed w.r.t , even if is used for the computation.
The parameter can be stored in a way allowing for unconstrained optimization, that is, the exponential function is used to compute the value from the model parameter. This parameterization is even better suited for optimization.
